htmlBody:
Hey - this was interesting, thanks for writing up!

Would you consider adding more tags to this post so it's more findable for potentially interested folks? Adding details to wikis is also really helpful.

I'm not an expert but this sounds like it could have an impact on: climate change, indoor air quality, engineering.

Also have you come across https://www.highimpactengineers.org/?

Thanks for sharing about your job, interesting to hear!

If this is even a 10 percent chance of this being true, that is insane! What mechanism would this be through, in quite ignorant here.

"I'd guess that a very smart person in HVAC could reduce global annual carbon emissions by 0.01% to 0.2% over the course of a career."

Thanks for linking to HI-Eng! We do in fact recommend HVAC as an impactful career for people who want to work on Indoor Air Quality to slow pandemic spread. It's great to hear about the experience of an actual HVAC engineer!
